title: Ticket #665: job suspension documentation explicitly mention STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS
description:
From Francesco Prelz:

Hi all,

a quick suggestion for the Condor manual.

It would help if Section 3.5.9.6 (Job Suspension) of the Condor manual (e.g. http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.3/3_5Policy_Configuration.html#SECTION00459600000000000000 ) with the nice per-slot suspend/continue example explicitely mentioned that the various slotX_Attributes are available only if the STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS configuration attribute is set as per section 3.3.10 (http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.3/3_3Configuration.html#SECTION004310000000000000000), as things fail pyrotechnically with the startd exiting when the latter attribute is not set.

I hope this saves some time to the next person who'd like to try.

Thanks. Francesco Prelz INFN Milano
remarks:
2009-Aug-14 12:55:45 by tannenba:
Dan B responded to condor-users w/ the below, so I am resolving this ticket. 

Thanks, Francesco!

In response to your helpful prod, we spruced up the suspension slot
example and added some features so that the policy works without
modification for machines with any number of cores.  That will be in the
next development release.

Best wishes,
--Dan
